author: Cedric Canard
content: I found all this truly interesting, especially your observation regarding setting the camera to B&W. I do that a fair bit (like you one of my memory settings is set to that). When I mention this to people (who are themselves photographers) they look at me like I'm weird. Why would anyone do that, they ask. But even though I don't have an EVF, if I know I'm recording B&W, then the world automatically looks B&W to me. I see shapes and shadows more readily. It's hard to explain but it does make a difference. I imagine it's even more pronounced with your camera Andreas.
